intro: Peyritschia curviseta, commonly known as the curved-horned grass, is a flowering plant species belonging to the Poaceae family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spikelet-based inflorescences. Peyritschia curviseta is typically found in grassland and rocky habitats, often in areas with well-drained soils. Its botanical structure reflects adaptations to arid and semi-arid environments.
